description: Mapping of asserted (base) relationships to inferred (derived) relationships

robotIsInSpace.description: Base relationship: Robot's location in space

inferred_relationships.reason: robotIsInSpace is a subproperty of objectIsInSpace
objectIsInSpace is a subproperty of isInSpace
spaceHasObject is a subproperty of hasObject

artifactIsInSpace.description: Base relationship: Artifact's location in space

inferred_relationships.reason: artifactIsInSpace is a subproperty of objectIsInSpace
objectIsInSpace is a subproperty of isInSpace
spaceHasObject is a subproperty of hasObject

isInsideOf.description: Base relationship: Object is inside another object

inferred_relationships.note: If container is in space, contained object is also in that space

isOntopOf.description: Base relationship: Object is on top of another object

inferred_relationships.note: If surface is in space, object on top is also in that space

carries.description: Base relationship: Robot carries artifact (derived from hasHand + isHeldBy)

inferred_relationships.reason: Property chain: isCarriedBy (inverse of carries) + robotIsInSpace → artifactIsInSpace
inferred_relationships.note: If robot carries artifact, artifact is in same space as robot

spaceIsInStorey.description: Base relationship: Space is in a storey

subproperty_inference.description: If A is a subproperty of B, then A(x,y) implies B(x,y)

inverse_inference.description: If A and B are inverse properties, then A(x,y) implies B(y,x)

property_chain_inference.description: If A + B → C is a property chain, then A(x,y) and B(y,z) implies C(x,z)

update_workflow.description: When updating an asserted relationship, the following inferred relationships are automatically updated

automatically_updated: isInStorey robot1 Floor_X (via property chain, if door_9 is in Floor_X)
old_relationships_removed: isInStorey robot1 Floor_Y (if corridor_14 was in Floor_Y)
